content: row single_crochet 7 the green stitches are all in the front loop of one stitch slip_stitch into the front loop of the next stitch chain 4 slip_stitch in same stitch chain 4 slip_stitch in same stitch chain 4 slip_stitch in same stitch single_crochet 7 repeat the other wing in the next single_crochet slip_stitch into the front loop of the next stitch chain 4 slip_stitch chain 4 slip_stitch chain 4 slip_stitch in same stitch 16 stitches summary row 6 single_crochet 7 flo wing single_crochet 7 flo wing = 16 stitches row 7 single_crochet 7 increase single_crochet into the unworked back loop from the row before single_crochet 7 increase single_crochet into the unworked back loop from the row before 18 stitches summary row 7 single_crochet 7 blo increase single_crochet single_crochet 7 blo increase single_crochet = 18 stitches row 8 single_crochet 18 18 stitches row 9 single_crochet 4 we complete the tail feathers in the next stitch the green stitches are all in the front loop of the next single_crochet slip_stitch into the front loop of the next stitch chain 5 slip_stitch chain 7 slip_stitch chain 5 slip_stitch in same stitch single_crochet 13 18 stitches row 10 complete two more normal single_crochet and move your stitch marker here to start this row this just aligns the first single_crochet 1 to be under the tail *decrease single_crochet 1* repeat around with the first single_crochet 1 being in the unworked back loop from the row before 12 stitches stuff stuff the chick with medium to light stuffing try not to stuff too firmly or the chick bottom will not sit flat eyes if you are using safety eyes please put them in now row 11 in the back loops only *decrease single_crochet 2* 9 blo stitches row 12 *decrease single_crochet 1* 6 stitches close bind off leaving a long tail thread this tail through the 6 remaining stitches pull closed and tie a secure knot thread this tail end up through the chick to the top and pull push the bottom up at the same time this should create a flat almost concave bottom to the chick beak i sew a simple beak and feet onto the chick i am a fan of the v_stitch beak over two row i find it very simple and effective i do the same v for the feet just over one row please embroider the face as you choose but my favourite method is to cut 30cm of yarn thread it up through the bottom sew the v_stitch in for the beak thread it down to the feet sew the two small v s for the feet thread the yarn back down to the bottom and tie together then thread both ends up through the head and cut off leaving 1 inch or so out for a
